author: kauegimenes

very customizable.project pageusageinstallation command is npm install jsonexport.run tests npm test.var jsonexport = require('jsonexport'); jsonexport({lang: 'node.js',module: 'jsonexport'}, {rowdelimiter: '|'}, function(err, csv){    (err) return console.log(err);    console.log(csv);});cliglobal filename>streamvar jsonexport = require('jsonexport');var fs = require('fs'); var reader = fs.createreadstream('data.json');var writer = fs.createwritestream('.csv'); reader.pipe(jsonexport()).pipe(writer);json objectcodevar jsonexport = require('jsonexport'); var stats = {    cars: 12,    roads: 5,    traffic: 'slow',    speed: {        max: 123,        avg: 20,        min: 5    },    size: [10,20]}; jsonexport(stats,function(err, csv){    (err) return console.log(err);    console.log(csv);});resultcars,12roads,5traffic,slowspeed.max,123speed.avg,20speed.min,5size,10;20customization order get most out this module, can customize many parameters functions.options * headerpathstring - string used create propriety path, defaults . example contact: {name: 'example} = contact.name * fillgaps - boolean set option don't to empty cells case an object multiple nested items (array prop), defaults false issue #22 * headers - array used set custom header order, defaults [] example ['lastname', 'name'] * rename - array used set custom header text, defaults [] example ['last name', 'name'] * rowdelimiter - string change file row delimiter * defaults , (cvs format). * \t xls format. * ; for (windows excel .csv format). * textdelimiter - string character used escape text content needed (default ") * endofline - string replace os default eol. * mainpathitem - string every header have mainpathitem the base. * arraypathstring - string is used output primitive arrays a single column, defaults ; * booleantruestring - string be used instead true. * booleanfalsestring - string be used instead false. * includeheaders - boolean set option false hide csv headers. * undefinedstring - string you to display custom value undefined strings, this option. defaults . * verticaloutput - boolean set option false create horizontal output json objects, headers the row, values the second. * handlestring - function this customize strings the csv file. * handlenumber - function this customize numbers the csv file. * handleboolean - function this customize booleans the csv file. * handledate - function this customize dates the csv file. (default date.tolocalestring)handle function option examplelets you to prepend text every string your csv file, to it?var jsonexport = require('jsonexport'); var options = {    handlestring: function(string, name){        return 'hey - ' + string;    }}; jsonexport({lang: 'node.js',module: 'jsonexport'}, options, function(err, csv){    (err) return console.log(err);    console.log(csv);}); output be:lang,hey - node.jsmodule,hey - jsonexportunleash awesomenessprivate packages, team management tools, powerful integrations. started npm orgs? learn more * kauegimenes published 2017-06-09t16:33:16.629z * 2.0.9is latest 27 releases * github.com/kauegimenes/jsonexport * isc ® collaborators list * stats * 127downloads the last * 2310downloads the last week * 4663downloads the last month * an issue? file . on github * github try out * test jsonexport your browser.keywords export, json, , 2, csv, converter, output, array, object, json--csv, json2csv, parse, stream, transform, big, files dependencies none dependents (9) ddf-validation, postgis-preview, eztranslate, myvariantjs, yamquery-excel, node-red-contrib-json2csv, lifetracker, vsdkjson2csv, more need help * documentation * support / contact * registry status * website issues * cli issues * security npm * npm, inc * jobs * npm weekly * blog * twitter * githublegal stuff * terms use * code conduct * package name disputes * privacy policy * reporting abuse * policiesnpm loves you
